newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan Islamic Bank H1 profits up 49 pct.
newsitem.headline: Jordan Islamic Bank H1 profits up 49 pct.

text.p: Jordan Islamic Bank on Wednesday said its pre-tax profits for the first half of 1996 rose to 20.7 million dinars, up 49.5 percent against the same period last year.

A bank official told Reuters the jump was partly credited to higher lending activities. Loans stood at 457.3 million dinars, a 9.5 percent rise in the first half of 1996 compared to the same period 1995.
The bank's largest shareholder is Saudi Baraka Islamic financial group, which has to keep within 49.9 percent ceiling for foreign ownership.

The bank wants to raise its capital to 22 million dinars from 15 million by a private placement and public offer to meet a 20 million dinar minimum capital ceiling by mid-1997 under a Central Bank deadline.
Shareholders rights -- capital and reserves -- rose to 41.9 million dinars in the first half of 1996, the bank said.
The bank, the country's only Islamic investment financial institution, is the third largest commercial bank in size of assets after Arab Bank and Housing Bank.
